intro: Calycoseris parryi, commonly known as the Parry's calycoseris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss. The flowers, which appear in spring, are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster.
